abstract: The board of Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation voted unanimously to approve a set of proposed rules intended to create an orderly process to unwind large financial institutions and recoup pay from senior executives.
snippet: The board of Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation voted unanimously to approve a set of proposed rules intended to create an orderly process to unwind large financial institutions and recoup pay from senior executives.
lead_paragraph: A top banking regulator approved a plan to seize and unwind big banks — a proposal that will help address those “too big to fail” firms whose collapse could imperil the financial system.

headline.main: F.D.I.C. Approves ‘Too Big to Fail’ Plan
